Line 59: Line 59:
==Athletics==
==Athletics==
[[Image:Ship_trans.gif|left|thumb|Athletic Logo]]
[[Image:Ship_trans.gif|left|thumb|Athletic Logo]]
â
Shippensburg University is an [[National Collegiate Athletic Association|NCAA]] [[Division II]] school and one of fourteen schools to compete in the [[Pennsylvania State Athletic Conference]]. The home venue of the universities [[Football (American)|football]] and [[track and field]] programs is [[Seth Grove Stadium]]. The school maintains intercollegiate programs for [[baseball]], [[basketball]] (Men & Women), [[cross country running|cross country]] (Men & Women), [[field hockey]], football, [[lacrosse]] (Men & Women), [[soccer]] (Men & Women), [[softball]], track & field (Men & Women), [[swimming]] (Men & Women), [[tennis]] (Women), [[volleyball]] (Women) and [[wrestling]]. Several club sports, such as [[Rugby union|rugby]] (Men & Women) and the [[Shippensburg Roller Hockey|inline hockey]] team, also participate in independent leagues. The team mascot and name is the [[Raider|Raiders]], although the name "Red Raiders" is still used officially for football and the school marching band. The team colors are blue and red. Shippensburg University has won several regional athletic championships, including the Dixon Trophy in: 1998, 1999, 2003, 2004, and 2005 for overall all-conference athletic achievement.<ref name="sports">{{cite web| url=http://www.ship.edu/~sid/| year=2007| title=About Shippensburg Athletics|first=| last=| publisher=Shippensburg University| accessdate=2007-02-08}}</ref>
+
Shippensburg University is an [[National Collegiate Athletic Association|NCAA]] [[Division II]] school and one of fourteen schools to compete in the [[Pennsylvania State Athletic Conference]]. The home venue of the universities [[Football (American)|football]] and [[track and field]] programs is [[Seth Grove Stadium]]. The school maintains intercollegiate programs for [[baseball]], [[basketball]] (Men & Women), [[cross country running|cross country]] (Men & Women), [[field hockey]], football, [[lacrosse]] (Men & Women), [[soccer]] (Men & Women), [[softball]], track & field (Men & Women), [[swimming]] (Men & Women), [[tennis]] (Women), [[volleyball]] (Women) and [[wrestling]]. Several club sports, such as [[College rugby|rugby]] (Men & Women) and the [[Shippensburg Roller Hockey|inline hockey]] team, also participate in independent leagues. The team mascot and name is the [[Raider|Raiders]], although the name "Red Raiders" is still used officially for football and the school marching band. The team colors are blue and red. Shippensburg University has won several regional athletic championships, including the Dixon Trophy in: 1998, 1999, 2003, 2004, and 2005 for overall all-conference athletic achievement.<ref name="sports">{{cite web| url=http://www.ship.edu/~sid/| year=2007| title=About Shippensburg Athletics|first=| last=| publisher=Shippensburg University| accessdate=2007-02-08}}</ref>
